course_title: Special Topics in NBB: Neuroethology Seminar
class_notes: Neuroethology   This seminar-style course will examine classic systems of neuroethology, the neural basis of animal behavior, concentrating on sensory systems and predation/escape behaviors. Topics will include electrical senses and communication in fish, honeybee behavior, use of ultrasound to hunt (bats) and avoid being eaten (insects), owl hearing, and other topics chosen by the class. Most of the course will consist of discussion of student-presented research papers, with a few background lectures.
course_description: Study of variable topics of special interest in neuroscience and behavioral biology. May be repeated for credit when topics vary.
sections: Class Nbr: 1383, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 10-11:15a, Instructor: R. Wyttenbach, Status: Open
